fields.description:
h3. Summary
* A fix was done previously on jira text field to limit the value to 32767 by default for JIRA 7 > ([JRA-28519|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-28519])
* However, the fix take effect to existing issue/data as well, where tickets that have more than 32767 value, cant be edited.
* For customer who cannot reduce this value (through database) due to this will breaks the information& data in the ticket, the ticket will not be allowed to edit by JIRA at all


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On JIRA 6.x, create a text custom field
# Append the text field with more than 32767 value
# Upgrade to JIRA 7.x

h3. Expected Results
# You will be able to edit the ticket
# You will be able to edit the value in the text custom field
# However, if editing the value in text custom field and save it, if more than 32767 count, JIRA should show an error

h3. Actual Results
You are not able to edit the ticket at all

h3.Workaround
You have to manually find the ticket with more than 32767 count and edit it (through database) by following this guide [OutOfMemoryError Caused by Large Comments or Descriptions in an Issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/OutOfMemoryError+Caused+by+Large+Comments+or+Descriptions+in+an+Issue]
fields.summary: Users are not allow to edit issue due to the fix on JRA-28519

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59556].
  {panel}

I have a mobile application and using that to connect with jira Rest API. Read and Edit of issue is working fine but Create new issue failing with server error 500 (message: "Expected authority at index 7: file://"). 

We are calling API: https://mgdemo.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue (Method: POST).

After more investigation, we find that, issue is due to Header: User-Agent have value: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/45.0.2454.85 Electron/0.34.2 Safari/537.36

After customization of User-Agent header, its working but, want a proper fix, so dont have to customize User-Agent header.

Customized user header we used: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; Win64; x64; AppleWebKit-537.36; Chrome-45.0.2454.85; Electron-0.34.2; Safari-537.36) like Gecko
fields.summary: Getting server 500 error when creating issue through REST API

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA throws a XSRF Check Failed during POST request types using CORS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Add domain to whitelist rule for domain to accept incoming requests 
!whitelist.png|thumbnail!
2. Create Issue with REST API (for example by using [Postman Interceptor|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/KB/Cross+Site+Request+Forgery%28CSRF%29+protection+changes+in+Atlassian+Rest]) and set 'Origin' header to same domain as the one added to whitelist
!postman.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
- Issue created successfully

h3. Actual Results
HTTP response:
{noformat}
XSRF check failed
{noformat}

The following is seen in _atlassian-jira.log_:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
2016-01-27 09:58:41,382 http-bio-8080-exec-17 WARN admin 598x202x1 gmldrg 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/api/2/issue [common.security.jersey.XsrfResourceFilter] Additional XSRF checks failed for request: http://localhost:8080/6412/rest/api/2/issue , origin: http://www.com , referrer: null , credentials in request: true , allowed via CORS: false
{code}

h3. Notes
- Only reproduced in JIRA 6.4.12

h3. Workaround
- set _Origin_ equal to BaseUrl
fields.summary: XSRF Check failed during CORS request

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As of JIRA 7.0.0+, the "+Accept remote API calls+" option in *Administration >> System >> General Configuration* has been removed. As explained in [JRA-44822 : Option to Accept remote API calls missing / gone / vanished|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-44822], this is done because the SOAP API has been removed.

When the user attempts to use Administration Search (Keyboard Shortcut g+g, or full-stop '.'), they can still type in parts of the phrase: "*remote API calls*", and this results in a hit for General Configuration. This is misleading since this configuration is no longer there.

 !remote_api_calls.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Suggested Solution
 
Revise the search criteria and prevent a hit for "remote API calls".


h3. Workaround 
No workaround as this does not cause functional issues.
fields.summary: Prevent "remote api calls" from resulting in General Configuration, in Admin Search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59540].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
We would like to disable or limit the use of the "Clone" issue in JIRA. The problem is that the cloning issues makes our issues less manageable. It would carry over too much information from the old issue such as assignee, due dates, fix versions, sprint, etc. while the new cloned issue hasn't been worked on. What the user really wants to do is just copy over the summary, description, etc.

h3. Suggested Solution
Simpler way: just the ability to disable "Clone" function, either globally, or based on users, groups, or project role.

Alternatively, allow us to specify which fields will be included/excluded when copying over information from the cloned issue to the new issue.
fields.summary: Make Clone Issue Configurable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59539].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

The *JIRA Concepts - Issues* page is a listing of all of the various Issue Types, Statuses, etc... specific to each instance. This page is helpful for users of an environment to familiarize themselves with the various configurations and customizations in the environment.

It is uncertain what causes it, but in JIRA 7.0.0+ , this screen will not display the Subtasks in the page: 

 !JIRA_7_Not_Working.png|thumbnail! 

This issue does not occur in JIRA 6.4:

 !JIRA_6_Working.png|thumbnail! 

This can result in users being uncertain of what subtasks are available in the environment, or what their purpose is. This would impact regular users as they do not have administrative privileges to view subtasks definitions in the Administration module.


h3. Environment
Consistently reproduced in JIRA 7.0.0+
Not related to browser as behavior was consistent across browsers


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Be in a JIRA 7.0.0+ environment
# Click *Create* to open the *Create Issue* screen, and click the Question Mark icon next to the Issue Type field.


h3. Expected Results

Subtasks should have an icon, title, and description


h3. Actual Results

The correct number of Subtasks is shown (Indicating JIRA is aware of them), but have no icon, title, or description
 

h3. Notes
No significant notes.


h3.Workaround
No known workaround at this time.
fields.summary: JIRA Concepts - Issues page shows blank subtasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59531].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
* The documentation  https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/connecting-jira-to-postgresql-185729433.html cover a minimal amount of basic security configuration so that the database user ID which JIRA uses to connect to the database is properly configured. It would be great if this article be clarified and extended so a systems administrator can configure PostgreSQL for JIRA quickly, without having to do a lot of research or carefully study the dozens of comments in the link you provided.
* Specifically, the existing documentation describes PostgreSQL commands to create the empty jiradb database and establish the PostgreSQL user named 'jira'. But the existing documentation neglects to describe configuring securty so PostgreSQL user id's and passwords are utilized for authentication (which is how JIRA and Confluence expect PostgreSQL to behave).
* This would help numerous Atassian end users, reduce database connectivity issues and perhaps reduce end-user support requests at Atlassian. The current documentation on this process could stand to be improved.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Please include how to configure PostgreSQL security in pg_hba.conf. The instructions provided by Atlasssian advise an authentication type of 'trust', which is insecure.
* The documentation should be clarified and expanded to provide directions for setting up the jira database user using 'md5' type authentication in pg_hba.conf.

h3. Workaround 
Refer to the PostgreSQL official documentation :
* http://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.1/static/auth-pg-hba-conf.html
fields.summary: Update PostgreSQL documentation to include security in pg_hba.conf

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59530].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
* It is currently possible to upgrade JIRA with incompatible plugins which will be an issue when JIRA starts up.
* For example, recently JIRA 7 was releases and there is a known issue where many incompatible plugins were causing a 500 page error :
** https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=781396615


h3. Suggested Solution
* JIRA should not allow the upgrade if there is any incompatible plugins currently installed ( in the {{installed-plugins}} directory
* JIRA should have a plugin/addon checker similar to https://bitbucket.org/peterkoczan/pluginversioncheckerthing/overview and only allow the plugin if all the incompatible plugins are removed.
* JIRA to remove redundant plugin
 
h3. Workaround 
* Upgrade JIRA with an empty  {{installed-plugins}} directory
fields.summary: Installer should check for incompatible plugins or add-ons before upgrade

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59527].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently JIRA/Tomcat doesn't have information about URI in Java thread name (Tomcat worker). This makes troubleshooting of performance problems more complicated, as it hard to get thread from URL and other way around. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Rename Java thread name and add URI, so it will look like:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
"http-bio-127.0.0.1-8080-exec-355, unique_id=Vp, time=1453, uri=/jira/browse/TEST/" daemon prio=10 tid=0x00002b0cd18f0800 nid=0x13ac runnable [0x00002b0cdad94000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
{code} 
See sample filter for Tomcat,  example: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14058233/naming-tomcat-worker-threads
 
h3. Workaround 
Use [Thready|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.ams.shipit.tomcat-filter/server/overview] plugin, it will add URL and User to thread name, so it will provide us extra information on the thread dump generation.
{noformat}
2016-10-25 13:32:35,081 http-nio-8080-exec-243 uri:/secure/admin/views/issuefields/screens/viewfieldscreens.jsp username:admin ERROR admin 806x861289x78 82gnu5 1.1.1.1 /secure/admin/ViewFieldScreens.jspa [webwork.util.ValueStack] METHOD: "deletable", exception: 
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Cannot find Screen with id '15608'.
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.WorkflowActionsBean.getFieldScreenForView(WorkflowActionsBean.java:73) [jira-api-7.2.2.jar:?]
{noformat}

h3. Fix
New version of ATST *1.32.1* contains Thready functionality , see  [ATST version-history|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1217696/troubleshooting-and-support-jira/version-history]
bq. If Jira is experiencing problems, Atlassian Support may ask for a set of thread dumps to help diagnose the problem. We now include the user ID and request URL in thread names, which can help us identify and troubleshoot issues faster.
fields.summary: Add URI to Tomcat worker threads

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA appears to upgrade correctly but fails when accessing Administrator functions such as the Applications and add-ons screens.

h3. Environment

* JIRA 7.0.9 or 7.0.10 
* Previously migrated from a JIRA Cloud instance 
* MySQL database

h3. Expected Results
JIRA will navigate to these pages without error

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
Caused by: com.atlassian.cache.CacheException: com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceExce
ption: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT lower_parent_name FROM cwd_membership WHERE (directory_id =  ? ) AND (lower_child_
name =  ? ) AND (membership_type =  ? ) (Streaming result set com.mysql.jdbc.RowDataDynamic@695f5925 is still active. No statements may be i
ssued when any streaming result sets are open and in use on a given connection. Ensure that you have called .close() on any active streaming
 result sets before attempting more queries.)
        at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCache$DelegatingLoadingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:330)
        at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizInternalMembershipDao.getParentsForMemberFromCache(OfBizInternalMembershipDao.java:3
70)
        at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizInternalMembershipDao.searchCache(OfBizInternalMembershipDao.java:355)
        at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizInternalMembershipDao.search(OfBizInternalMembershipDao.java:309)...
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround

Run the following SQL and see if this applies to your situation 
{noformat}
select * from cwd_user where user_name like 'addon%'
{noformat}

If users are returned from the SQL query:
# Go to User Management and find any users whose username begins with "addon_".
# Delete these users.
fields.summary: JIRA 7.0.9 fails with SQL error when using MySQL Server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59502].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
the Atlassian logo in the image of automatic JIRA emails don't appear to contain a file extension. This causes some customers' email servers to not trust the message altogether and in some cases delete it from the server.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.1.0-OD-05-006
* JIRA Service Desk - 3.1.0-OD-11-002-D20160113T081536

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a new user in JIRA User Management that will trigger a "Welcome to Atlassian [Cloud]" email.
# View original message including headers, will find the problematic lines that I am going to mention down below.

h3. Expected Results
- See in an email generated from Confluence (EAC):
!Screen Shot 2016-01-22 at 12.40.49.jpg|thumbnail!
- Text included in original message:
{noformat}Content-Type: image/png; name=footer-desktop-logo.png
Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
Content-ID: <footer-desktop-logo>
Content-Disposition: inline; filename=footer-desktop-logo.png{noformat}

h3. Actual Results
- Email generated from a welcome email on a JIRA Cloud instance:
!Screen Shot 2016-01-22 at 12.40.36.jpg|thumbnail!
- Text included in original message:
{noformat}Content-Type: image/png; name=footer-desktop-logo
Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
Content-Disposition: inline
Content-ID: <footer-desktop-logo>{noformat}

Note how Confluence includes .png at the end of the file, but JIRA does not.

h3.Workaround
No current workaround
fields.summary: Footer Images included in automatic JIRA emails contain no file extension

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59501].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian

As already commented on JRA-59427 it would be great to see the tables with wrong collation already in the Health checker user interface.

In our case we were also alerted by the health checker and after running the query documented in Confluence we found one table that someone had created for test purposes and indeed this table had the wrong collation 

But since it was not relevant for JIRA it could be deleted without impact and the health checker went happy as well.

Our JIRA administrators - which are *not* database administrators - would have a better feeling if they could judge first if there is a real problem with the database and only bother the database administrators if it is really necessary.

it should not be such a big effort to implement this since the queries are already run by health checker. It's just to give us a little bit more of the already existing information in the UI.

Another option would be to let health checker only check the tables relevant for JIRA but this could become a more difficult task since this might be hard to answer for some tables.

Regards,
Dieter
fields.summary: Display tables with incorrect collation in Health Checker user interface

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59498].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When an external user management that JIRA connect to is not reachable (maybe it is down, or there is network issue), there will be no notification in JIRA side. Following that, user login will fail.

h3. Suggested Solution
Trigger a notification that the external user directory is not reachable.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59496].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently it is only possible to add value of *Original Estimate* from sub-tasks when viewing issues listed in an *Epic* issue type. It would be useful if this option is widened for other issue types as well such as tasks and bugs.

h3. Suggested Solution
In *Advanced Application Properties*, add another key to display table according to tasks or bugs.
 
h3. Workaround 
None at the moment.
fields.summary: Ability to view Original Estimate in issues listed in Epic for all issue types

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59495].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The "Log Work" functionality is using the JIRA System "Default user time zone" to set the "Date Started".
It should be using the "User Time zone" set in the Profile section

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to an issue, click on "Log Work" and check the Time in "Date Started"
# Change your user timezone by going to your Profile
# Refresh the issue
# Click on "Log Work" and check the "Date Started" field again

h3. Expected Results
The Time defaults to the timezone recently set in the profile

h3. Actual Results
The Time remains the same as before because it still uses the JIRA "Default user time zone"

h3. Notes
Changing the JIRA "Default user time zone" under "General Configuration" will change the time shown by default by the "Log Work", confirming the link between them.
All other dates in the issues, such as Created, Updated, Comment times, change accordingly to the user timezone.
fields.summary: Log Work uses Default user timezone instead of User's timezone

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Disabling the jira-importers-plugin causes the Software and Service Desk applications to disable. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to manage add-ons >> all add-ons
# Disable jira-importers-plugin

h3. Expected Results
The JIM plugin should be a system plugin and therefore not subject to being disabled.
h3. Actual Results
The JIRA Applications become disabled, and JIM is disabled as well
 
h3.Workaround
Re-enable the JIM plugin, then re-enable the other plugins, or restart.
fields.summary: JIRA Importers Plugin needs to be a system plugin

h3. Problem Definition
Previously, admin would be able to select multiple permissions by highlighting the permissions and assign it to groups/roles/users. The current method which is using a dialog does not allow the user to select multiple permissions in one selection. The user would need to select and load the permissions one after the other.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow selecting multiple permissions in one selection
fields.summary: Allow selecting multiple permissions in Permission Scheme

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update as of 2018, July 25th|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#68cff2|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

This is an update to inform you that this ticket is invalid.

The key used here, {{jira.permission.create.clone.denied}}, is invalid, and JIRA is just throwing a valid error:
{code}
Unknown type 'clone' in meta attribute 'jira.permission.create.clone.denied'. Valid permission types are defined in permission-types.xml
{code}

Using the right key, {{jira.permission.createclone.denied}}, the problem shouldn't happen.

JRASERVER-67652 is about a similar, valid bug when using the right key, and there is a Workaround. Please watch it for more details.
{panel}

{panel:title=Original Description}
h3. Summary
When a user adds {{jira.permission.create.clone.denied}} in a workflow property, running the *[Get create issue meta|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/issue-getCreateIssueMeta]* with _expand=projects.issuetypes.fields_ fail
{code}http://localhost:8080/jira/rest/api/latest/issue/createmeta?expand=projects.issuetypes.fields{code}

I understand that this is an incorrect usage of the property (JRA-34816), but the reason this Bug is raised is because workflow properties seems unrelated to metadata for creating issues. Adding workflow properties should not break an unrelated part of JIRA

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add {{jira.permission.create.clone.denied}} in a workflow property of a Status
# Verify that users won't be able to clone issues in that particular status
# Run [Get create issue meta|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/issue-getCreateIssueMeta]

h3. Expected Results
The metadata should be returned normally

h3. Actual Results
# The below exception is thrown as a response
{noformat}<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<status>
    <status-code>500</status-code>
    <message>Unknown type 'clone' in meta attribute 'jira.permission.create.clone.denied'. Valid permission types are defined in permission-types.xml</message>
    <stack-trace>java.lang.RuntimeException: Unknown type 'clone' in meta attribute 'jira.permission.create.clone.denied'. Valid permission types are defined in permission-types.xml
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.WorkflowPermissionFactory.createWorkflowPermission(WorkflowPermissionFactory.java:86)
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.WorkflowPermissionFactory.getWorkflowPermissions(WorkflowPermissionFactory.java:42)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.workflowPermissionCheck(WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.java:196)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.workflowPermissionCheck(WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.java:172)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.workflowPermissionCheck(WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.java:137)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.hasPermission(WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.java:83)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.DefaultPermissionManager.hasPermission(DefaultPermissionManager.java:103)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.hasPermission(WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.java:76)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.ApplicationRequiredPermissionManager.lambda$hasPermission$235(ApplicationRequiredPermissionManager.java:71)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.ApplicationRequiredPermissionManager$$Lambda$365/587147594.getAsBoolean(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.ApplicationRequiredPermissionManager.checkUserHasApplicationOrFalse(ApplicationRequiredPermissionManager.java:177)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.ApplicationRequiredPermissionManager.hasPermission(ApplicationRequiredPermissionManager.java:71)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor392.invoke(Unknown Source){noformat}
# Results are returned when *expand=projects.issuetypes.fields* is removed, but this doesn't return the required data

h3.Workaround
No known workaround
{panel}
fields.summary: jira.permission.create.clone.denied in workflow property breaks Get create issue meta API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59486].
  {panel}

*Feature Summary*
When a user attempts to configure a custom field with a lot of context for a large number of projects trying to add a new option or even make a new value the default value, they are forced to do this one at a time as JIRA does not have a feature that allows them configure such a change across all contexts for the said custom field.

*Feature Request*
Add a feature that allows users bulk change contexts in the configure page for custom fields so that changes made can be made more seamlessly than having to do this one at a time when they have the custom field linked to about 50+ projects with each project having it's own expected context.
fields.summary: Add Bulk Edit for Custom Field Context

h3. Summary
Upgrading to JIRA 7 while using the built-in (in-memory) database fails with error:
{code}
problem adding Upgrade Task Deleting invalid version associations
{code}

h3. Environment
* This affects the migration from HSQL to H2. H2 is the new built-in database introduced in JIRA7, while HSQL has been in use across all versions prior to JIRA7. 
* JIRA will need to perform some migration steps to move from HSQL to H2. (this is done automatically during upgrade)
* Effectively, this means the bug affects any customer currently using the internal HSQL database and is upgrading to JIRA 7.0 or newer. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 6.4.11 using the installer. Complete the setup process through the browser as well, then shut down JIRA.
# Upgrade the installation in step 1 using any JIRA 7.0.x version installer. 
# At one point during the migration from HSQL to H2 procedure (you can track this in the logs), you will be asked to restart:
{code}
2016-01-12 23:33:58,362 localhost-startStop-1 WARN      [c.a.jira.startup.EmbeddedDatabaseMigrator]

    *****************************************************
    JIRA must be restarted to complete the import process
    *****************************************************


    Please restart JIRA to complete the HSQL to H2 database migration
{code}
(i) The UI will also inform you that you need to restart JIRA. [^Restart.png]

h3. Expected Results
The Upgrade completes successfully after the restart and you can access JIRA.

h3. Actual Results
After restarting, JIRA fails to start up correctly and gets locked.
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:

h3.Workaround
# Restart a couple more times, (this is a *seemingly random behaviour*) and eventually JIRA is able to be started successfully without the error message OR
# Use an external database instead OR
# Try this process to restore from an automated XML backup:
** Stop your JIRA.
** Go to your {{<JIRAHOME>}} and delete *dbconfig.xml* and remove all the files from {{<JIRAHOME>/database}} directory.
** From {{<JIRAHOME>/import}} directory, remove *hsql-migration.zip*.
** Copy your latest automated backup file from {{<JIRAHOME>/export}} to {{<JIRAHOME>/import}}
** Restart your JIRA and choose to use in build database.
** In some cases JIRA would have restored your old data. If it's not restored, please restore the automated backup that you moved earlier using [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/restoring-data-185729565.html] method.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users loading multiple project overview pages at a time will render incorrectly to some of its content, following the last page loaded by the user. This can easily reproduced when loading the Project Overview page took 5 seconds or more.

h3. Environment
* Tested on JIRA 6.4.12

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Disable new Project Sidebar
# Open 4 projects in different tabs, land at Project Overview page
# Ensure all projects took more than 5 seconds to load
# Refresh all tabs quickly

h3. Expected Results
The content in each Project overview renders correctly

h3. Actual Results
3 out of 4 projects has incorrect content which retrieved from the last refreshed project.
 
h3. Notes
* Jira page is builded from many small web fragments. Each web fragment has template that defines how it will look like. The template use values like user-name, project-key from provided context.
* This is interesting how legacy project page populate the project object to the context. When user visit project page, it save the last visited project into user history. Later when page is rendered, for each web fragment, everytime it take the latest project from user history. 
If in meantime user will open another project page, the history will be changed and semi rendered pages will start rendering web-fragments for a different project.

h3.Workaround
* Use new Project Sidebar or Project Centric view
fields.summary: Opening Multiple Project Overview at once can lead to Incorrect Rendering of Content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59478].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When modifying a workflow, or setting up a workflow, it would be good to ensure the transition lines do not over lap statuses, and ideally an option to 'tidy' the workflow exists. 

There is no feature to prevent the lines from running over the status labels, however it is typically possible to layout most workflows so that they don't have lines (transition connections) overlapping the actual status labels. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Look at implementing a method to tidy or avoid the transition lines overlapping the Status transitions.  

h3. Workaround
Manually move the statuses and transitions around in the Workflow designer until the Workflow is easy to read and no transition lines overlap status in the workflow.
fields.summary: Prevent Transiton Lines overlapping statuses in View Workflow and Workflow Designer

fields.description:
We have a custom field in our system - "End Date"
We then installed BigGantt which added a custom field "End date"

When writing JQL, type ahead matching when you type "End" shows both fields with unique custom field ID's. 

Even if we select "End Date", it still searches against "End date" - so even though the display shows unique fields based on the case, the JQL doesn't seem to recognize case in it's CF matching.

To confirm the rest of our JQL logic is correct, we renamed "End Date" to "End Date 2" and this then selects the correct data, however we cannot leave this field as End Date 2 for a pile of regression issues (filters, queries, scripts etc)
fields.summary: JQL custom fields aren't case sensitive

Steps to reproduce:

1. Go to System, Admin, Integrity Checker.
2. Run only: Check search request references a valid project
3. In the result if you have errors you can see

Actual results:

The link for "JRA-2279" in that text is 

http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/key=JRA-2279

which appears to be a format no longer supported by j.a.c 7.0.x, so the link is broken

Expected result: the link should work.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59472].
  {panel}

Hi All:

I know that there might a ticket with this suggestion. But it would limit my ability to expand JIRA's capacity of work.

Anyways, 

Currently, JIRA has Epic as an "Agile" issue type that can gather multiple user stories and bug fixes. However, there are some users that are confused on understanding the meaning of the word *Epic*. Is Epic a requirement issue type? Super User Stories? Or something else. 

In order for me as JIRA administrator is to extend the ability to create other Epic level issue types (like Requirement, etc) in order for users to get clarity on creating their tickets. 

P.S: As a reference, look how admins are able to create subtask-level issue types in addition to the *Sub-task*.

Thanks
fields.summary: As JIRA Admin, I need the ability to create Epic-level issue types

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In JIRA, it is possible to write a plugin and make use of IssueManager and that would override all JIRA rules.

For example, 
A customer added a postfunction script using Script runner. And this script creates issues in JIRA with a specific issue types. At some point they created a project which doesn't have this specific issue type in its issue type scheme. Even with this setting, this script was able to create an issue in this project with the set issue type knowing that that project doesn't have this issue type in its scheme.




h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make use of the IssueManager instead of  com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.IssueService (for example).

h3. Expected Results
JIRA should validate the input before making any changes to JIRA instance

h3. Actual Results
Manager interfaces in JIRA don't validate input. So, data can get inserted to the database without any validation. 

(i) Third party developers are recommended to use services instead of managers.


However, we need to make JIRA more fail safe by preventing users from making this mistake.
fields.summary: As a plugin developer, it is possible to write a script to override JIRA rules by using IssueManager

fields.description:
h3. Expected Behavior
As described by [JRA-14031|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-14031], it's expected that the browser will warn users if they try to navigate away from a page where form data has been entered.

h3. Actual Behavior
The browser doesn't warn at all, so users have to rely on caching to hold the information entered, which depends on the browser. On a OS X system, for example, the behavior of browsers is described below.

|| Chrome | Form data is saved when creating a new comment |
|| Safari | The whole state of the page is saved |
|| Firefox | Page loads as new |

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start entering a comment or editing any field;
# Navigate away from the page, either through the back/forward buttons or by clicking a link;

h3. Workaround
Users can use *Lazarus Form Recovery* on [Chrome|https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/lazarus-form-recovery/loljledaigphbcpfhfmgopdkppkifgno?hl=en] or [Firefox|https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/lazarus-form-recovery/] to be able to recover form data without relying in intermittent cache functionality.

(!) _Please note this is a third-party product, therefore not supported by Atlassian._
fields.summary: [Regression] Form data lost when navigating away from a page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using JIRA's CSV Import feature, when user import a CSV file with *default time tracking time set to anything other than minutes*, JIRA displays wrong value for the estimated time. This issue can't be reproduced if the the CSV import is done using the External import feature.

 !csv_import3.jpeg|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment

JIRA 6.4.12 -> JIRA 7.0.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1) Import a CSV file with the following content:
Summary;Fix Version;Original Estimate (in seconds);Issue Type
issue 1 (estimated 8h = 1d);1.2.3;28800;Task
issue 2 (estimated 40h = 5 d = 1w);1.2.3;144000;Task
issue 3 (estimated 2h = 0.25 d);1.2.3;7200;Task
issue 4 (estimated 15' = 0.25 h);1.2.3;900;Task

2) Open the Issue navigator to see the time tracking value

h3. Expected Results

independent from default time tracking unit the result should be
issue 1: 1d
issue 2: 1w
issue 3: 2h
issue 4: 0.25h 

h3. Actual Results

(time tracking set to day)
issue 1: 0d
issue 2: 1d
issue 3: 0d
issue 4: 0d
and if default time tracking is set to hour:
issue 1: 1d
issue 2: 5d
issue 3: 0.25d
issue 4: 0d
and if default time tracking is set to minutes:
issue 1: 1d
issue 2: 5d
issue 3: 0.25d
issue 4: 0.25h
and if default time tracking is set to weeks:
issue 1: 0d
issue 2: 0d
issue 3: 0d
issue 4: 0h

h3. Workaround

Importing for External Import function will import the CSV file with right time tracking value.
fields.summary: Incorrect Original Estimate after CSV Import

h3. Problem Definition
A user is able to guess usernames of users with the help of the User Picker. The User Picker will show results if the typed username is correct. For example, lets say a user is trying to guess a username "admin". The user types in "admin" in the Reporter field, and an entry appears in the User Picker: [^Autocomplete.png] This then helps the user to imply "this user actually exists because JIRA autocompletes it for me".

This was not the case in JIRA5, where no auto-complete results were shown even if the user guessed the username correctly. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Do not provide any results from the User Picker even if the user is able to guess the username directly. 
 
h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: User Picker should not load any results for users with no Browse Users global permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

Hi Atlassian Support,

Time stamps used by JIRA in time HTML tag are not compatible with ISO8601, thus they are not easily converted to other formats.
This is affecting especially automation tools and scripts.

{code:html}
<time datetime="2015-11-21T17:37:45+0100" class="livestamp">21.11.15 17:37</time>
{code}

Buggy part is in time zone designator part of this time stamp.
2015-11-21T17:37:45+0100 - this is what JIRA is serving us
2015-11-21T17:37:45+01:00 - this is how it is supposed to look like defined by ISO8601

Note the colon in time zone designator part.

Reference - http://www.iso.org/iso/catalogue_detail?csnumber=40874
W3 - https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime-970915 - free of charge

Thanks,
Oskar
fields.summary: Time stamps are not ISO8601 compatible

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59424].
  {panel}

As per costumer feedback:
{quote}
It may be better to exclude the whole /jira-home/caches/ directory all together, as it looks like this is just temporary content as well as the indexes. There is also the tmp folder, which looks to be the same kind of thing. I'd guess those two locations are the most likely to be modified during a copy.

I've tried copying the HOME folder without either of those two directories (using exclude commands in rsync) and Jira actually starts up fine without them. It re-creates them when it first runs and starts to fill them with content again. The index page says that the index is missing and that it should be restored and re-built; re-creating it only took 6 minutes or our test system.

I think it would be very good to update the documentation in light of all this. Right now, it says "create a snapshot of the data directory (including all files and subdirectories), then back up the snapshot":

https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/backing-up-data-185729581.html

I think it would be better and clearer to say:

"The recommended method of backing up the data directory is to copy it to another location while excluding both the /jira-data/caches/ and /jira-data/tmp folders, and then to archive the copied folder (using zip, tar.gz, etc). This is because the content in those two folders is frequently modified, which may cause the copy to fail, and because Jira will simply re-create these folders and their content if they are missing.

NOTE: the Jira index is stored inside the caches directory, so will be lost using this method. You can enable "restorable index" in the system options to create backups of the index, which you can then restore later. Alternatively, if time is available, you can re-create the index from scratch after you have restored Jira.

Here is an example rsync command for the copy:

rsync -avh --delete --exclude 'caches' --exclude 'tmp' --stats --progress /jira-data/ /jira-rsync/

"

That would definately have helped me when I was configuring the backup.
{quote}
fields.summary: Clarify the meaning of snapshot in the -backing up data- documentation
